channel.title: Management games?
channel.description:
I feel the need to waste massive chunks of my life again, and nothing can achieve that in quite the same way as a good management game
I've played all the Simcity series, and Roller Coaster Tycoon 1 and 3, and thoroughly enjoyed them. Can any of you fine people recommend something else to try?

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: m4rek
item.description:
taxi_evil:

I’ve downloaded OpenTTD but need to find a tutorial or manual for it I’ll make the effort now I know its worth playing

https://www.tt-forums.net/ for all your TTD needs

Read full topic

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Hyperbyte:

Well, if you’ve tried all those and are up for a challenge I can recommend Civilization IV. There’s quite a nice offer on Steam at the moment as well. It takes a while to get the hang of it, and it takes lots of effort to master it completely, but once you do, you’ll realize it’s simply one of the (if not the) best strategy/management game ever made.

Plus it has an incredible replay value, since no two games are the same and there’s no strategy that guarantees victory. It’s absolutely one of my favorites and I can’t wait until Civilization V comes out.

I picked up a copy of Cvilization 4 complete edition last year, and did enjoy it. To the point where I was playing it on the bus on the way to uni

m4rek:

I have a copy of JPOG, woot xD

Good games from back in the day? Railroad Tycoon… Not my fav though. Personal favourite was always Transport Tycoon (Deluxe). If you’re gonna go back to TTD, I bring your attention to TTD Patch and OpenTTD.

Theme Hospital was always nice, as was RCT, Pharaoh and Ceasar 3…

I’ve downloaded OpenTTD but need to find a tutorial or manual for it I’ll make the effort now I know its worth playing

Read full topic

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
taxi_evil:

I feel the need to waste massive chunks of my life again, and nothing can achieve that in quite the same way as a good management game

I’ve played all the Simcity series, and Roller Coaster Tycoon 1 and 3, and thoroughly enjoyed them. Can any of you fine people recommend something else to try?

Well, if you’ve tried all those and are up for a challenge I can recommend Civilization IV. There’s quite a nice offer on Steam at the moment as well. It takes a while to get the hang of it, and it takes lots of effort to master it completely, but once you do, you’ll realize it’s simply one of the (if not the) best strategy/management game ever made.

Plus it has an incredible replay value, since no two games are the same and there’s no strategy that guarantees victory. It’s absolutely one of my favorites and I can’t wait until Civilization V comes out.

Read full topic

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
The original Stronghold was an RTS however it also had a peaceful campaign where you managed resources. If you also like RTS that you should defiantly pick up.

Read full topic

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
Jurassic Park Operation Genesis (Here’s a Challenge; find a Legitimate copy!)
JPOG is pretty easy to mod if you know what you’re doing. You can Change prices of items, Research time, Tour Vehicle maximum altitude/range, Change the models of the guests to those of the dinosaurs, all from the source files (which are text files, easily re-written).

Read full topic

item.title: Management games?

item.description:
My fault, I meant management as in simcity, the sims, tycoon games, theme games, etc

Call them buildy games, if you will
Suggestions for games from ‘back in the day’ are always welcome

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Cameron :smiley: :

Age of Empires/Empire Earth?

Those are RTS, not management games.

Try Theme Hospital. Shitty Graphics but it gets quite difficult as you progress.

item.title: Management games?
item.dc:creator: Xynos
item.description:
Anno 1404
Did you mean like, resource management? Not sure to exactly what you refer.

Edit: Then Anno 1404 still stands, its heavy on resouce management but has a (albeit shitty) combat system.
